They've got bases, several of them, a shitload of caches, and they've got helicopters dropping supplies off at the perimeter. Their commander is some kind of Gromov... I think his name's fake - they call him 'Major' or 'Thunder'. You don't believe me?! So Pakhomich caught an interception somehow! Caught him, and God help him, or they'd have kicked him for good... Secrecy, that's what it is! Everybody knows Pakhomych, don't they? Well, that's just it! It's not bullshit, it's a serious team. I don't know what they're up to, but they're doing a hell of a job. I wish I had a third - no, ten percent like that! - I'd have built a house in Sochi on ten floors by now... They say they have this thing... they can spot monsters from two hundred metres away. Any kind of creature! Sure as hell would be walking around the Zone spitting... They say there're some guys... Not soldiers, but some of ours... Anyway, some guys snuck into the centre of the Zone. It's not enough that they snuck in - they say they can tame beasts too! They do not go beyond the perimeter, to the Big Earth, and nobody goes to them either... well, except those who it is the nature to sarcophagus... They have artefacts enough to wipe their ass with! "The Duty Boys know about them... they know, they fight, but they don't say anything. If you ask one of these cops: "Tales", he says. Aren't they bitches?

Brothers, did you hear that some infidels got close to the antennas recently? The Monolith sent us, and the brothers spotted them in time. We took out one at once. The other two took off running. Cowards. They're all cowards. Only true faith leaves no room for fear! Two managed to escape, but the Monolith is wise and all-knowing. Then he needs them alive.

Brothers, the Monolith summoned me in the night. I spoke to him. He was beautiful in his majesty. I almost went blind, but his light filled me with great power! I know, I feel, that his power abides with us all! He told me that only a strong faith can defeat evil. He told me that his power would only fill the faithful. He also told me that our victory is near!

What I think... I'm not even thinking, I'm just guessing... What if everything - all that is here - is an experiment on people? Maybe it's some kind of green men... Why? I wonder, if this is some kind of test site, what exactly are they testing here? Checking out which artifacts we drool over the most? Or are they bombs of some kind, huh? They got them all over the world, all over the labs, rich people paying for them... No, that's cool... That's what I'd like to see. You buy some shit under the table, pay a lot of money, like, "We're the best," envy them, and it fucks it up. Oh, great! Oh, I can't believe it. Oh, I don't know what's really going on. Whoever went for the radar can tell you about it. Yeah, maybe they know, but they can't say it. They just moo and drool. Maybe that's why they're drooling... Eh... That's what's making me think... It's not fun at all...

I've been to the Dark Vale. There's a lot of infidels there, because the power of the Monolith hasn't reached these places yet. We were guarding. At night we were attacked. We fought fiercely against those animals. The merits of the brothers were great: Monolith soon called them to himself. For me, he had prepared another test. My weapons were no longer firing. But then the Monolith said to me, "You are with me, and my power is with you. If you are steadfast in your faith, you will crush my enemies and come close to me!" Then I became a shadow. I ducked down and went around to their right. The foolish spies didn't notice anything. They thought they were done with us and laughed at the empty bodies of our brothers. But I could already see their backs. And then the power of Monolith struck from my hands. So it killed them all. I am happy to serve you, Perfect One!

My partner and I have been looking at this research institute for a long time. It's a desolate place. No animals around, no mutants. But whoever went there was either scared out of their wits, or never saw them again. We decided to scout around on our own. We set off in the dark, and by the time we reached the place it had already begun to dawn. We left the car in a clearing, went on a wood to the edge. We stopped there, the partner stayed below, and I got on a tree with optics to look round what was going on in vicinity. I saw the houses, not completely abandoned, almost all the windows were intact, there was not much grass in the yards, unlike in other places - up to the waist... It looked like people lived here, but there was complete silence and no movement. Suddenly bursts of gunfire hit me from the right, someone was using short rifles. I aimed my telescope over there. I saw on a roof of one of the buildings an unfamiliar guy - like a rat, hunted and shooting indiscriminately in all directions. Who - I looked and could not understand: he was alone there. And then... it started... I saw everything as if on the palm of my hand. The machine gun flew out of his hands... It was like the wings had grown on the iron... The guy opened his mouth, yelled something, took out a knife and put it in front of him. And then - holy shit! - I look, and there's another one hanging in front of him. It's hanging there with its stinger in the air, and no one is holding it. What happened next is out of the question... For five minutes they cut the man up. Little by little, bit by bit, bit by bit, bit by bit, bit by bit... Poor guy was soon covered in blood... Then, when he started to wriggle, his knife got knocked out too... The guy got lifted in the air and twisted a couple of times... I've never seen anything like that in my life - like a rag... I was wet in three seconds... Then... No, I'm not going to... Anyway, when I got my breath back, I spent another five minutes wandering around with the scope. My hands were shaking, my optics were wet with sweat... At least one creature! Nothin' in the normal and infra-red ranges. When I got down my partner looked at me and decided not to ask. When I got back to base I was drunk up to my eyebrows for a week. Then, when I got back, I asked around, see if anybody had heard anything about it. Only people started to ask me if I was crazy. That's the way it is...

Brothers, we were patrolling the outskirts of the Black Forest when we stumbled upon a lone infidel. He started to turn, so we didn't kill him, but he was still half in his animal state... I know the wise Monolith did this for all of us: he showed us again the true face of his enemies. Now our faith is even more strengthened! It's coming, brothers! Victory over the infidels is nigh, and then the Monolith will fulfill our deepest desire! He will bring the truly faithful closer to himself, to his glory, to his greatness! We shall forever shine in his glory...!

Anyway, my friend told me this. His bosses woke him up in the middle of the night and told him to run to the lab. He's sleepy, doesn't understand: what cargo? They said to him: Have you been drinking too much alcohol? There's a fresh corpse on the table, it's ready to eat! Anyway, he comes to the table. And there's something... He, in fact, the dead men from the Zone in his time has seen: and you torn, and fried vArenaey, and got mutants not one dozen, and here like a dinner in the stomach began to walk. I was a bit like a normal guy, but he had a big lumpy pumpkin on the side. And his body was a fucking concentration camp, skin and bones. But he understood it afterwards, but at first he said that he saw some mess: everything was covered with orange-red dirt, like blood... Those fuckers didn't spare any ammunition. Do-olg... search for anomalous objects, man... no fucking way!... He said it was a mixture of a colander and a torn heating pad... ...and they were walking all over him in their shitpants. It was a piece of meat in black rags. Anyway, he spent the rest of the night and half of the morning slaving away. I guess that's the creature the locals know as the illusionist: black rags, stalker visions, head six feet in circumference... The funny thing about his face, whoever saw it, they thought it was his forehead. Nah, he really has a personality, but he is very small: his blinkers are not opening, and his nose is like a pin, though his mouth is huge, just a jamb at the gate. He walks and hangs his head on his chest - he can't hold it straight... ...and guess what these things eat for lunch. Mushrooms! Mushrooms! Anyway, everyone saw - the Zone is full of mushrooms, so the "old men" give a tooth that these things are juicing from them. Gourmands, damn it... And do you know what he had stashed in a bag on his side? Well? No way! Anyway, his brains were jerky. Do you know whose? A controller's.

One fool came to our place... So we take a five-minute rest, and he gets right on his heels - and relaxes. He's the last one to get his ass off the ground. So he relaxes... he lags behind, and his controller grabs his brains! - and that's it. If you're new to the business, remember. A rustle or a suspicious breeze... Let a bunny run by... although bunnies are God forbid here... In a word, you have to be ready every second. I've got magazines and grenades at hand and a submachine gun on uninterrupted. If you see something, just take out half a magpie; if something's behind the bushes, hit it too, and then ask. It's a young fighter's course here: they don't give you a warning, they gobble you up before you can make a fart. Yeah, there's a separate story about controllers. Let's say you shoot at a rustle and immediately fall down, in the same second! On your back or whatever. The controller clings if it sees you - it needs to concentrate or something. While you're sunbathing in the shade, listen to both ears to see if there's any rustling, any crap coming towards you. You can quietly flick the magazine, and it wouldn't hurt to have grenades ready... So if everything's quiet, you count to three and... And off you go! Get the hell out of here! Did you suck it? Take care of yourselves every second. It's the only way to survive here.

So... I remember someone asking me something yesterday, but I forgot... Oh, I remember. So there are those who are curious as to why only our eggheads hang around in the Zone and why foreigners don't show their noses, even though there's about three thousand Nobel laureates... So I'll answer point by point. Firstly, why on earth would they bother to come here when they can give us a grant with such conditions, that he will bring everything you need on a silver platter? Secondly, they have actually been here a lot. It's been the last two years the foreigners are afraid to go to the Zone... one big bummer happened to them. Now they're just buying up materials and information. The pay's pretty good, so a lot of loners work for them, and looters too... What, you haven't heard about this story? You don't say! The whole Zone was on its ear, and you fell out of the sky. Anyway, it was a big deployment. Thirty scientists alone from half the world... all the luminaries, of course, back and forth... They made serious preparations: they were loaded with money, equipment - a mountain. We took a platoon of military-specialists for protection, three of our guides, loaded the shielded BATERs and set off. We returned a week later... twelve men on the dead-beat BATER. We got to the spike at Rottenwood, and there they were... ...looters... Yeah... They don't care where they came from... They got almost all of them. Only three got out of the perimeter - two of ours and one egghead. Impressions made the man go wild in the attic... Well, quickly grabbed him by the scruff of the neck and treated. Now he's writing a book about the Zone. Our guys are all right. Experience helped. Although... they probably went their own way too: one went to the radar and disappeared, and the other went to the Big Land. And the rest were taken by the Zone. Have you heard about the Thirty-two Town? That's where they got caught. At first everything was quiet... well, within limits... They were surveying there, collecting samples, poking at anomalies... And then they went berserk. A mass madness. People started slowly going nuts. Our man, the one who retired, told me... Some started tearing their throats out with their nails, some smashed their heads against the wall, and some simply put a gun in their mouths, and... And then the beasts came. Some of them were in themselves, barricaded themselves in the house. Imagine that, huh? Outside it's night and all the creatures are out there, and inside, people are going crazy one by one. In a word, in the morning, those who were still sane got out. They drove straight back, without the road; they even picked up a few anomalies... We made it to the Rotten Forest... And those who stayed there, they couldn't find anyone. Guys just say there's been a spike in controllers in that area. Yeah... Since then, no one's been going to Town-Twenty-Two, and you can't lure a foreigner into the Zone...

So that's what I wanted to say. When they took that illusion, I was there! I just happened to be in the area. My car, my Niva, the right front one broke off. The bolts sheared off in the bump. And there's nothing for spare parts. I swore a lot, and then let me go to the factory to pick up the right ones. It was a kilometre to walk there - a half an hour! And I'd been there before... Suddenly I saw - "a duty"! Not just any patrol, but half a hundred of them. Well, I think it's a bloody mess... He just stood there and fell into the bushes. "If they spot me and start combing through," I thought, "that's the end of me. So I lay down in the hole and tried not to breathe. And here comes the shooting! I'd only heard such gunfire once in my life ... when they took the first base - the old men, remember? So I'm lying there, listening in both ears... It bangs, and then it bangs... Five minutes later it goes quiet and no one comes to me. Well, I got up the nerve, stood up a bit and looked through the binoculars. And they were dragging themselves out of the workshop... battered, dragging a heap of their dead men behind them and the illus on the tarp... only scraps were left of the illus... They ducked into a ravine. Then I hear the engines roar and the sound goes away. I waited a bit longer, nobody seems to be there. I go in. I know you can't find anything after Duty. But it was interesting! I'll tell you, that was something! They almost poked through the walls. Beams across the floor, a piece of roof collapsed. Shell casings up to their knees - a real firing range. Blood, bits and pieces... I didn't find anything useful - just two full cans, and a machine gun lying there, crushed by a beam... I forgot about the bolts... I went back to the car, thought for five minutes, took a bolt off the other wheels... and drove slowly... And if I had gone there a half an hour earlier... Yeah...

Yeah, that's how I got to the outskirts of Pripyat. So I decided to look around first thing. I found a place higher up - there was a big boiler house with a chimney. Well, I went carefully... as if everything was all right - there was dust, no traces... I got into the furnace and crawled: there were steps inside the chimney. I crawled in it as if everything was all right - it was petrified. It's beautiful! Half the city in the palm of my hand! I took out my binoculars and looked round... (Small pause) And so on... I was about to slip downwards, but the thought occurred to me: what was going on under my nose and I did not look! I bend over the edge a little, look on one side, then on the other... Well, that's what I was looking at! There's a dwarf walking around the courtyard! The main thing is, I'm almost down there. It's all right that he can't see me yet. But I can't blow his turret off, the Kalash is hanging on my back, and the pipe is too narrow to turn around. Using the Makarov under my arm - shit, it's fifty meters, and the difference in height ... in short, if I do not get right away - and I'm sure I will not - then the end of the world. I'm sitting here thinking. And at the same time, I'm watching what he's doing. He was doing something strange. At first he was so briskly, so light-heartedly, rummaging around in the heap of rubbish - only bits of it were flying off to the right and to the left. And then suddenly he just stood there and froze. He seemed to listen. And then it became a real mess. The rubbish in that pile started to move on its own. Dwarf quickly jumped away, stood like a pillar, put his hands on his head, twisted his palms in a sly way... and it flew at him! From all sides!.. Tin, bricks, roofing felt, branches... He was so over his head. Well, I think that's it. That's it, the kitten won't pee again... No way! For two seconds the rubbish lay there, and then just like that it splashes in all directions! There were some pipe scraps, and they hit the concrete fence. He stood there for half a minute, pondered something, and then turned around and went back to the building. I took a minute to catch my breath. "Well," I thought, "it's a bit of a good thing, let's get out of here. Suddenly there was a puff of smoke. And then it got hot. Go to hell! Someone started a fire from downstairs! In a minute - that was it, there was nothing to breathe. I could manage to reach the edge of the chimney - there was no shelter there, so I sat down and put my feet up... The smoke still eats my eyes, i.e. there was not enough air... in short, i had to leave urgently! I always carried a half-meter of cord just in case of fire... I was sure I was a fireman... So, I halved the cord - it was not too thick - I tied it to the chimney at the best advantage, tore my scarf in two, wrapped it around the belt, and crawled up, praying to all the gods... My only thought was: Better not to fall down! I couldn't find a safety rope, it cut my hands... Of course, by the law of bad luck, I was five meters far from the ground. I had to jump. What to do? Oh, I'm in a jam! I was lucky, I didn't break anything... But I injured myself and my right leg was badly pulled! Then I thought I'd torn a ligament. And then I yanked it so hard, I could have won the gold medal in the race...

I couldn't believe my eyes at the time. You'd think there were pretty girls, right? But this one was... she was... Perfect. Yeah. There. Perfect. It felt like the world around her was black and white and blurry, she was the only one in colour and sharpness. The way she moved! I've never seen that before either. I got a lump in my throat. She doesn't need this science! What's she doing here, in the Zone? Yeah, in the Zone. It was late afternoon... There's a separate nine-storey building by the bus station. First something flashed in the window on the ground floor. I took the safety off the "kalash", and then I look - she's coming out of the doorway... I wanted to rub my eyes - what can you expect from the Zone? And she walks up. I'm standing there like a fool, staring... I have my gun ready - it's a habit... She spots me... She smiles... She says hello... I can't hear her, I keep staring at her. She wore a blue jumpsuit, a bright one... but not a hoodie, almost tight... Her figure was something fantastic! It was then that I realized that I was not listening to what she was saying - I stood there and smiled ear to ear... She, it turns out, was from the research group. She asked me if I could help her. She! I'd go into an anomaly for her...! She said that she's working on these, what are they... endemics of the Zone. You know, plants that are only found here. Said she escaped from the guards because there's no leeway with them, and she came here alone. I don't know. I believed it. I agreed to help her - bring her something. Two days later, I showed up like we talked about. Almost got myself killed five times while I was packing it up. As I walked, I had one thought in my head: I'm going to see her again! And nothing. I didn't even see the house where I met her. Just like that... But what was she like! She was glowing on the inside...
